item.title: Threat Modeling for Cloud Applications: A Comprehensive Approach to Security Design
item.description: Threat modeling for cloud applications requires a fundamental rethinking of traditional security assessment approaches because cloud-native architectures introduce unique attack vectors, shared responsibility models, and dynamic infrastructure patterns that weren’t present in legacy systems. The distributed nature of cloud applications, combined with their rapid deployment cycles and ephemeral infrastructure components, creates a complex threat landscape that must be analyzed systematically to identify potential security vulnerabilities before they can be exploited by malicious actors.
